subject: Re: DESIGN TILES WEBSITE - REBRANDING + CHANGES/UPDATES
preview: Hi Joel,  Thanks for the walk-through. Appreciate it  Regards, Samir B

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel,

Thanks for the walk-through. Appreciate it

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

Here is a quick video on how to set a tags for New Arrivals and Best selling.
https://www.loom.com/share/04c699b5a5c14ae69596949998c8b0af

The attached image is how the active filters looks like.

Hi Joel,

Do you have an update on this?

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Joel,

"Back arrow" on the top left corner that appears when new arrivals or best selling is selected would be ideal. Also, Could you please explain if I were to show the product in the new arrivals or best-selling for any category, what's the process for me to do it at the back end?



let me know if you have any questions

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

Sure, can you send a screenshot where the position of the backarrow?


Regarding settings the tags, Please assign the products with the tags below.
Best Selling
New arrivals

Hi Joel,

Thanks for your email. Could you please explain the process to implement this at the bank end? Also is it possible to add an icon "back arrow" maybe that signifies to go back when the customer is browsing through those filters?

let me know if you have any questions

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

Sure, we have updated the staging.

Have a look at these stg page.
https://stg-designtiles-stg.kinsta.cloud/product-category/tiles/porcelain-floor-wall-tiles/

Hi Joel,
Thank you for your email. I've reviewed the updated staging site, and I have some concerns regarding the aesthetic appeal. The lengthy category names seem to detract from the overall look, even when shortened to terms like "Best-selling" or "New arrivals." Additionally, given our multiple parent categories and the inability for categories to have duplicate values, this approach may not be feasible. I believe the solution proposed by Heath to focus on tags could be the way forward. However, the tags must adhere to the condition we discussed previously, ensuring that "Best selling" or "New arrivals" are clearly indicated for each respective category, as outlined in my previous email.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

We have updated the staging, let me know if this works for you?

https://stg-designtiles-stg.kinsta.cloud/product-category/tiles/porcelain-panels/
  • The buttons will show the sub category "BEST SELLING PORCELAIN FLOOR & WALL TILES" and "NEW ARRIVALS PORCELAIN FLOOR & WALL TILES" and linked to the category page.

https://stg-designtiles-stg.kinsta.cloud/product-category/tiles/porcelain-floor-wall-tiles/best-selling-porcelain-ceramic-tiles/
  • The buttons will show to go back to parent category page which is the "/porcelain-panels/"

attachments.filename: Porcelain Floor & Wall Tiles > Best Selling Porcelain Floor & Wall Tiles.png

full_threads.body:
Hi Samir,

We are still working on this on staging, we will update you over the weekend.

Thanks for the update, Joel.

4)Regarding your suggestion about modifying "New Arrivals" and "Best Selling," we appreciate the recommendation. However, we would like to maintain the current functionality of these features. The only adjustment required is to ensure that when users select "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the respective category are displayed. For example, if a user is browsing the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category and selects "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category should be shown. We are making changes on staging, we will send you an update in a bit.

Do we have an update on this?

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

We have updated the site.

  • "Green Certified," "Italian Tiles," and "Spanish Tiles." should always be showing up.
  • Product listing should be showing the Title and price at all times. Desktop or Mobile view. When hovered The tags, View Product and Quick View will show up.

Hi Joel,

Thanks for all the changes.

It appears that we are encountering ongoing challenges with mobile responsiveness, particularly concerning the product page. The product title appears to be truncated (refer to the attached image). If the hover slider is the culprit, I suggest exploring a layout akin to Tilecloud's (refer to the attached image). This adjustment seems more conducive to user experience, allowing customers to promptly view the product name and price without additional steps associated with hover functionality.

Regarding the display of tags, please ensure that the following tags are included: "Green Certified," "Italian Tiles," and "Spanish Tiles." While I currently see them, I'd like to double-check their presence to ensure accuracy.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

We have updated the site. Please see below:

1)The cart and checkout page are not mobile-responsive. ( Image Attached ) **DONE**

2)The checkout process lacks web and mobile responsiveness, particularly when multiple products are added. (Image attached) **DONE**

3)All product tags are visible on hover. ( Image attached ) **DONE** I have hidden the tags, can you send the list of tags that are needed to be excluded?

4)Regarding your suggestion about modifying "New Arrivals" and "Best Selling," we appreciate the recommendation. However, we would like to maintain the current functionality of these features. The only adjustment required is to ensure that when users select "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the respective category are displayed. For example, if a user is browsing the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category and selects "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category should be shown. We are making changes on staging, we will send you an update in a bit.

5)On the search page, all products display "product" underneath the product name. Please replace this with the price.( Image attached) **DONE** https://www.designtiles.com.au/?s=tiles

Regarding the approved task, I will send a separate email for this one.

Hi Heath,
I'm pleased to inform you that I have received approval for the functional changes outlined in Items 2 and 3. Here's a quick recap of our requirements:

2)Get a Sample (Image Attached): We've noticed that many customers are experiencing difficulty understanding the size of sample orders. To address this issue, we propose implementing an image template pop-up. When a customer selects "Get a Sample," they'll be presented with this template, providing clear information about the sample size. After reviewing the template, the customer can proceed to purchase by selecting "Continue to Purchase." This confirms their sample order

3)5 Samples for $5 Offer: As part of a promotional initiative, we're introducing a special offer: when a customer selects 5 samples for $5, a $20 discount should be automatically applied to their order.

Should you have any questions or require further clarification on these requirements, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Joel,

Firstly, I want to thank you for implementing the recent changes on our website. Your efforts are greatly appreciated.

However, I have identified several issues that still need to be addressed promptly. Below is a list outlining the issues along with some attached images for clarity:



  1. 1)The cart and checkout page are not mobile-responsive. ( Image Attached )
    2)The checkout process lacks web and mobile responsiveness, particularly when multiple products are added. (Image attached)
    3)All product tags are visible on hover. ( Image attached )
    4)Regarding your suggestion about modifying "New Arrivals" and "Best Selling," we appreciate the recommendation. However, we would like to maintain the current functionality of these features. The only adjustment required is to ensure that when users select "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the respective category are displayed. For example, if a user is browsing the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category and selects "Best Selling" or "New Arrivals," only products from the "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" category should be shown.
    5)On the search page, all products display "product" underneath the product name. Please replace this with the price.( Image attached)


Given the potential impact on the customer's purchasing journey, I kindly request that these issues be treated as a priority and also make sure there are no such issues with all our pages. It's crucial to ensure that the website functions smoothly to provide an optimal user experience. If any issues arise during the resolution process, I will keep you posted.

Your prompt attention to these matters is greatly appreciated. Please let me know if you need any further clarification or assistance in resolving these issues. I can be reached at 0416098245.

Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

Confirming we have updated the site.
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product-category/bathroomware/

Regarding the "Best selling" and "New arrival", Sorry for getting back in forth with this.
Would it help if instead of showing "Best selling and New arrival"? We will show the sub category when clicked it will be redirected to that subcategory?


For example if you are on "Pavers & Outdoor Tiles" instead of showing New arrivals and best selling, it will show the "Best Selling Pavers & Outdoor Tiles",

If you are on "Porcelain Floor & Wall Tiles" instead of showing New arrivals and best selling, it will show the subcategory,
  • Best Selling Porcelain Floor & Wall Tiles
  • New Arrivals Porcelain Floor & Wall Tiles

Hi Joel, Thanks for your email and making all those changes.
  • FYI, I've noticed issues with the font on the search page and mobile view. Please help me fix it, I will come back to you if I notice more. ( Pic attached )
Regarding "NEW ARRIVALS" and "BEST SELLING" filter as you can see here - The best way to fix this is to add the "New Arrivals and Best Selling" as a tag. This tag will be applied to all products. So once the product has been assigned to "new arrival" and "Best selling" tags we can now remove the subcategories "new-arrival" and "Best selling". We have created the "New arrival" and "Best Selling" as tag. I understand what you mean. Ideally, we want to show best-selling and new arrivals products for each category. For example, when the customer is in the Porcelain Floor and Wall tile category, the best-selling and new arrival option should only show products for " Porcelain Floor and Wall tile ". We don't want "best selling" and "new arrival" to show bathroom products while the customer is browsing for " Porcelain Floor and Wall tile ". If I were to add "New Arrivals and Best Selling" as a tag. Will it incorporate this requirement? Let me know if you have any questions. Regards, Samir B

Hi Samir,

We have updated the live site. 

Here are a few things that needed to be actioned. 

The header is now updated but we have not live the new Home page. Please see below:

Header 
Menu - Not yet linked
Gallery - RESIDENTIAL
Gallery - COMMERCIAL

Home New - https://www.designtiles.com.au/home-new/ (Accesible when you are logged in)
Section - 5 Sample for $5! - Button order your samples link
Section - Free advice to get your designer look - BOOK IN-STORE link
Section - Design Tiles showroom - Slider Images

Product Category Pages
https://www.designtiles.com.au/wp-admin/edit-tags.php?taxonomy=product_cat&post_type=product
- Category images are need for each product category
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product-category/bathroomware/
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product-category/tiles/

Regarding "NEW ARRIVALS" and "BEST SELLING" filter as you can see here
https://www.designtiles.com.au/product-category/tiles/porcelain-floor-wall-tiles/
- As you can see on this page should show products instead of 2 subcategories of porcelain floor wall tiles. This is a default feature of woocommerce, as long as the category has a category inside of it. 

- The best way to fix this is to add the "New Arrivals and Best Selling" as a tag. This tag will be applied to all products. So once the product has been assigned to "new arrival" and "Best selling" tag we can now remove the sub categories "new-arrival" and "Best selling". We have created the "New arrival" and "Best Selling" as tag. 

Let me know if you have any questions.

Hi Samir,

Thanks for confirming, we will perform the live changes later tonight after working hrs. We will backup the site before and after the live changes.

We will send you an email once it is done.

Hi Heath/Joel,

Please disregard this request for the time being and let's proceed with updating the live site with the changes below.
Lets stick onto lower case similar to mobile view(right)



Also, Kinsta server is not letting me to backup current website. If you can help me to backup would be appreciated.

Let me know if you have any questions

Thank you.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Heath/Joel,

Please disregard this request for the time being and let's proceed with updating the live site with the changes below.
Lets stick onto lower case similar to mobile view(right)



Also, Kinsta server is not letting me to backup current website. If you can help me to backup would be appreciated.

Let me know if you have any questions

Thank you.

Regards,
Samir B

Hi Samir,

These functional changes are possible, however will be charged additionally to the initial 20hrs quoted to Pelin for the design changes.

Item 2 will be an additional 2.5 hours.
Item 3 will also be an additional 2.5 hours.

Please confirm if we are ok to proceed with these changes?

Also, any changes required to the Calendly widget will need to be made at the Design Tiles end as we don't have access to or manage the Calendly account for you.
